segment.source: Customize Automatic Search in Internet Explorer so that your employees can type a single word into the Address box to search for frequently used pages.
segment.target: Customize Automatic Search in Internet Explorer so that your employees can type a single word into the Address box to search for frequently used pages.

segment.source: Customize Automatic Search using IEAK 11 (Internet Explorer Administration Kit 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Customize Automatic Search using IEAK 11 (Internet Explorer Administration Kit 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Customize Automatic Search for Internet Explorer using IEAK 11
segment.target: Customize Automatic Search for Internet Explorer using IEAK 11

segment.source: Internet Explorer lets websites advertise any search provider that uses the open search standard described at the A9 website ( OpenSearch 1.1 Draft 5).
segment.target: Internet Explorer lets websites advertise any search provider that uses the open search standard described at the A9 website ( OpenSearch 1.1 Draft 5).

segment.source: When IE detects new search providers, the Search box becomes active and adds the new providers to the drop-down list of providers.
segment.target: When IE detects new search providers, the Search box becomes active and adds the new providers to the drop-down list of providers.

segment.source: Using the Administrative Templates section of Group Policy, you can prevent the search box from appearing, you can add a list of acceptable search providers, or you can restrict your employee’s ability to add or remove search providers.
segment.target: Using the Administrative Templates section of Group Policy, you can prevent the search box from appearing, you can add a list of acceptable search providers, or you can restrict your employee’s ability to add or remove search providers.

segment.source: Automatic Search Configuration
segment.target: Automatic Search Configuration

segment.source: You can customize Automatic Search so that your employees can type a single word into the Address box to search for frequently used pages.
segment.target: You can customize Automatic Search so that your employees can type a single word into the Address box to search for frequently used pages.

segment.source: For example, you can let a commonly used webpage about invoices appear if an employee types invoice into the Address box, even if the URL doesn’t include the term.
segment.target: For example, you can let a commonly used webpage about invoices appear if an employee types invoice into the Address box, even if the URL doesn’t include the term.

segment.source: If a website can’t be associated with the term, or if there are multiple matches, a webpage appears showing the top search results.
segment.target: If a website can’t be associated with the term, or if there are multiple matches, a webpage appears showing the top search results.

segment.source: To set up Automatic Search
segment.target: To set up Automatic Search

segment.source: Create a script (.asp) file that conditionally looks for search terms, and post it to an intranet server here: http://ieautosearch/response.asp?MT=%1&srch=%2.
segment.target: Create a script (.asp) file that conditionally looks for search terms, and post it to an intranet server here: http://ieautosearch/response.asp?MT=%1&srch=%2.

segment.source: For info about the acceptable values for the %1 and %2 parameters, see the Automatic Search parameters.
segment.target: For info about the acceptable values for the %1 and %2 parameters, see the Automatic Search parameters.

segment.source: For an example of the script file, see the Sample Automatic Search script.
segment.target: For an example of the script file, see the Sample Automatic Search script.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If you aren’t using IIS in your company, you’ll need to remap this URL to your script file’s location.
segment.target: If you aren’t using IIS in your company, you’ll need to remap this URL to your script file’s location.

segment.source: On the Additional Settings page of the IEAK 11, click Internet Settings, and then click Advanced Settings.
segment.target: On the Additional Settings page of the IEAK 11, click Internet Settings, and then click Advanced Settings.

segment.source: Go to the section labeled Searching and type intranet into the Search Provider Keyword box.
segment.target: Go to the section labeled Searching and type intranet into the Search Provider Keyword box.

segment.source: To redirect to a different site than the one provided by the search results
segment.target: To redirect to a different site than the one provided by the search results

segment.source: In the Advanced Settings section, go to the section labeled Searching and change the When searching from the address bar setting to Just go to the most likely site.
segment.target: In the Advanced Settings section, go to the section labeled Searching and change the When searching from the address bar setting to Just go to the most likely site.

segment.source: To disable Automatic Search
segment.target: To disable Automatic Search

segment.source: In the Advanced Settings section, go to the section labeled Searching and change the When searching from the address bar setting to Do not search from the address bar.
segment.target: In the Advanced Settings section, go to the section labeled Searching and change the When searching from the address bar setting to Do not search from the address bar.

segment.source: Automatic Search parameters
segment.target: Automatic Search parameters

segment.source: You must replace the Automatic Search script file parameters, %1 and %2 so they’re part of the actual URL.
segment.target: You must replace the Automatic Search script file parameters, %1 and %2 so they’re part of the actual URL.

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Value
segment.target: Value

segment.source: The text string typed by an employee into the Address bar.
segment.target: The text string typed by an employee into the Address bar.

segment.source: The type of search chosen by an employee.
segment.target: The type of search chosen by an employee.

segment.source: This can include:
segment.target: This can include:

segment.source: 3. Display the results and go to the most likely site.
segment.target: 3. Display the results and go to the most likely site.

segment.source: 2. Go to the most likely site.
segment.target: 2. Go to the most likely site.

segment.source: 1. Display the results in the main window.
segment.target: 1. Display the results in the main window.

segment.source: 0. Don't search from the Address box.
segment.target: 0. Don't search from the Address box.

segment.source: Sample Automatic Search script
segment.target: Sample Automatic Search script

segment.source: This is a VBScript-based sample of an .asp Automatic Search script.
segment.target: This is a VBScript-based sample of an .asp Automatic Search script.
